# Action

**Type Alias**

A type that describes a control associated with a tip.

## Declaration

```swift
typealias Action = Tips.Action
```

## Overview

Use actions to provide additional help and guidance for people looking to get started with your tip. Actions appear at the bottom of your [doc://com.apple.TipKit/documentation/TipKit/TipView] in the form of buttons.

You create an action by providing an `id` and a `title`. The `id` is a string that uniquely identifies the action. The `title` is text that displays as the label on the button.

You can pass a function for the system to call when the action triggers by setting the `perform` attribute in the [doc://com.apple.TipKit/documentation/TipKit/Tips/Action/init(id:title:perform:)] initializer. Or you can set the action parameter in the [doc://com.apple.TipKit/documentation/TipKit/TipView/init(_:arrowEdge:action:)] initializer of your [doc://com.apple.TipKit/documentation/TipKit/TipView].

## Initializers

- **init(id:perform:_:)**: Creates a tip action that displays a custom label.
- **init(id:title:perform:)**: Creates a tip action that generates its label from a string.

## Providing actions

- **actions**: Buttons that help people get started or learn more about your feature.
